pitchLine: I am a degree educated Software Engineer with 3 years of experience in developing software for Web and Desktop Operating Systems. My work philosophy is to bring as much value as I can to the workplace because we are not paid for the time but for the value we bring. To assure my professional growth I set quarterly objectives for myself, continuously expand my skills, take new responsibilities and accept feedback graciously.

experiments.name: Account Surfer
experiments.description: Quickly switch between accounts and browsers

experiments.name: Trello Bookmark
experiments.description: Store your bookmarks as Trello Cards

projects.name: Diffblue
projects.description: In this role I am writing software in Java in an Agile environment for Diffblue Cover, a tool powered by AI that automatically generates (unit) tests for Java code. I make a consistent commitment to growth by embracing continuous learning (i.e. each Sprint I study a topic relevant for my work) and by taking new responsibilities (e.g. lead stand-ups and Sprint Retrospectives). Last, but not least, I set up and maintain an online environment where the product can be tried, see diffblue.com/try-cover-browser

projects.name: Diffblue
projects.description: Played an important role in the development and launch of a cloud addon for Jira. The addon allows you to bring context to Jira tickets by linking them to customer data. I helped through pair-programming sessions one of my colleagues to transition from a Technical Consultant position to a Developer one. Throughout my time at New Verve Consulting I took advantage of the half-day per week allotted to career development to improve with the relevant technologies for the position. Managed my time between writing my MSc dissertation and the position successfully.

projects.name: SSI Schaefer
projects.description: Got exposed to the world of professional software development with Java as well as finishing my last year of BSc studies in Computer Science. I worked on the development of software for a vertical lift module (LOGIMAT) that allowed goods in a warehouse to be stored and managed efficiently. Managed my time successfully between the position and my last year of BSc studies.

volunteer.description: I conducted a series of lectures for BIONIC University. Main topics: HTML / CSS / jQuery / Handlebars / Ajax / Production experience / Best practices

education.place: Kiev Institute of Business and Technologies (KIBT)
education.degree: Bachelor's Degree, Management, Managment of business activities

education.place: Moscow State Institute of Radio engineering, Electronics and Automation (MIREA)
education.degree: Master's Degree, Computer Science And Information Technologies, Software and computing systems (software engineer)

recommendations.name: Alexey Morozov
recommendations.text:
I've worked with or around Marat at N-iX for about a year and I've been consistently impressed with his passion and drive for quality software. He strives for excellence in all he does is able to build quality into everything he works on.

 Moreover, we've been working together on several projects before N-iX and Marat led all of them to a production-ready solution that was scalable and ready to bring value to the business. As a Technical Lead Marat was able to take the idea from Stakeholders, introduce decomposition and deliver the end-solution. He was responsible for technical excellence and people management within the team. He guided everyone towards one end goal!

recommendations.name: Nikolay Mirkula
recommendations.text:
Marat is an amazing professional, who brings all of the skills and expertise in programming and web development. His productivity and ambition sets a great example for the rest of the team. It was indeed a wonderful thing to work with him as the Lead Frontend Engineer at Moqod company.

 As a colleague, I recommend him to other institutions who may want to hire his most treasured skills

recommendations.name: Michael Sebastiyan
recommendations.text: Marat is an excellent software engineer. He's very passionate about tech, building great user experiences, and improving the project codebase. He's a very high value add to every team he works on.

recommendations.name: Sergii Kalashnykov
recommendations.text: It was a pleasure working with Marat. He is a very talented passionate JavaScript developer, and a good friend. During that time I was impressed with his skill set and the way he could think through problems and find a solution for them. I would be happy to work with him again in the future.
